description: This course explores the foundations of cognitive, achievement, adaptive, mood, personality, and forensic testing in psychology. Students will develop an understanding of the purpose of psychological testing and the ways in which it is used in practice, including which careers in psychology use what types of tests and the training required to engage in various forms of psychological testing. Students will practice administering, scoring, and interpreting bachelors-level appropriate psychological tests. Prerequisite: PSYCH 125.
